description: Demolition of existing buildings on site and redevelopment to provide new industrial buildings (Class B2/B8), ancillary landscaping, HGV servicing, refuse, car parking ad associated works.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: CONLAN Site Description: SCRAP METALSite Name: SORO PRODUCTS LTD
SIARIN Description: Roman road of Ermine Street and contemporary roadside settlement inclusing Leighton RoadName: Ermine Street
CILRES CIL ZONE: Lower Rate Eastern Zone - RATE: £40 per square metre
DMDAAP Designation: Area Action Plan- Area: North East Enfield- Policy: Core policy 40
DMDSIL Designation: Strategic Industrial Location- Industrial Area: Great Cambridge Road- Policy: DMD 19, 21, 23- Core Strategy: Core policy 14
DMDWCO Designation: Wildlife Corridor- Policy: DMD 76- Core Strategy: Core policy 36

decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the decision notice. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans, as set out in the attached schedule which forms part of this notice. Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Prior to occupation of the development, a Verification Report demonstrating that the approved drainage / SuDS measures have been fully implemented shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. This report must include:	As built drawings of the sustainable drainage systems including level information (if appropriate)	Photographs of the completed sustainable drainage systems	Any relevant certificates from manufacturers/ suppliers of any drainage features	A confirmation statement of the above signed by the site manager or similarReason: To ensure the sustainable management of water, minimise flood risk, minimise discharge of surface water outside of the curtilage of the property and ensure that the drainage system will remain functional throughout the lifetime of the development in accordance with Policy CP28 of the Core Strategy, DMD 61, and Policies SI12 & SI13 of the London Plan and the NPPF.

Prior to commencement of the development a Fire Statement shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing. The Fire Statement shall be produced by an independent third party suitably qualified assessor and shall detail the building's construction, methods, products and materials used; the means of escape for all building users including those who are disabled or require level access together with the associated management plan; access for fire service personnel and equipment; ongoing maintenance and monitoring and how provision will be made within the site to enable fire appliances to gain access to the buildings The development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the details approved for the life time of the development.Reason: To comply with Policy D12 of the London Plan 2021.

Prior to first occupation of the development all energy efficiency measures, and low/zero carbon technologies proposed to be incorporated in the development - as set out in the approved Energy Strategy (ref. 3427-27-210205- Energy and Sustainability Statement Rev B) - shall be installed and operational in accordance with the details set out in the approved Energy Strategy.Reason: To reduce greenhouse gas emissions in accordance with the energy hierarchy, Policy SI 2 of the London Plan and DMD 51 of the Enfield DMD 2014.

Prior to first occupation of the development details showing how the development will achieve at least the BREEAM excellent standard for the 'Wat 01' water category (or equivalent measure of water efficiency) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details of water efficient measures.Reason: To ensure the efficient use of water in accordance with Policy SI 5 of the London Plan 2021 and DMD 58 of the Enfield DMD 2014.

Prior to first occupation of the approved development, details showing that the development achieves a Certificate of Compliance to the relevant Secure by Design Guide(s) or, alternatively, achieves Crime Prevention Standards shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority in conjunction with the Metropolitan Police.The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter shall be fully retained and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.Reason: In the interest of creating safer, secure, sustainable communities in accordance with Policy D11 of the London Plan and DMD 37 of the Enfield DMD 2014. In aiming to satisfy Condition No. 17 the applicant must seek the advice of the Metropolitan Police Service Designing Out Crime Officers (DOCOs). The services of MPS DOCOs are available free of charge and can be contacted via docomailbox.ne@met.police.uk or 0208 217 3813.

No above ground works shall commence before details of the siting and number of ecological enhancements (e.g. creation of native wildlife-friendly tree planting and installation of bird boxes) designed into and around the new building and its associated landscaping have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The siting and type of these ecological enhancements shall be chosen under the supervision of a suitably qualified ecologist.Reason: To enhance the biodiversity of the site and borough in accordance with Policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and DMD 79 of the Enfield DMD 2014, by providing suitable nesting features for birds and/or bats.

Prior to first occupation of the development, details (such as photographic evidence) showing that the ecological measures have been installed in accordance with the approved details shall be submitted to the local planning authority.Reason: To enhance the biodiversity of the site and borough in accordance with Policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and DMD 79 of the Enfield DMD 2014, by providing suitable nesting features for birds and/or bats.

Prior to commencement of the development a Green Procurement and Construction plan shall be submitted to Council and approved in writing. The development thereafter shall be carried out in strict accordance with the approved details. The submitted Green Procurement and Construction Plan must detail how the development has sought to minimise the environmental impact of the scheme through responsible sourcing of materials, minimising construction site impacts, local procurement and employment strategies and the minimisation of construction and demolition waste.Reason: To comply with policy DMD 57 of the Enfield DMD 2014.

Prior to occupation of any unit, a Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The proposals will be maintained in accordance with this Plan unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To comply with policy DMD 48 of the Enfield DMD 2014 and policy T7 of the London Plan 2021.

The glazing indicated on drawing No. 1787-JSA-Z1-XX-DR-A-04201 P6 (west elevation) shall be fixed shut and be of obscured glass with an equivalent obscuration as level 3 on the Pilkington Obscuration Range. The glazing shall not be altered without the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To safeguard the privacy of the occupiers of adjoining and neighbouring properties.

No development above existing ground level shall commence until details of the external finishing materials to be used shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. A schedule of materials and their use in the approved scheme is required and samples made available on site.  A photograph showing all samples to be inspected must be submitted.  The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory external appearance.

Prior to first occupation of the approved development, full details of the 24 long stay and 12 short stay cycle parking spaces shown on the approved plans shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The 24 long stay and 12 short stay cycle parking spaces shall be installed in accordance with the approved details before the development is occupied.Reason: To ensure the development provides adequate cycle parking facilities

Prior to first occupation of the approved development, full details of refuse storage arrangements shown on the approved plans shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The applicant would need to demonstrate that the capacity of the refuse bins meets the requirements of ENV08/162.Reason: To ensure the development provides adequate cycle parking facilities

Prior to the installation of any mechanical plant, an acoustic report, setting out the generated sound level and noise control measures shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Noise from the combined plant must not exceed a level of 5dB(A) below background noise levels at the façade of the nearest residential property.Reason: To protect the local amenity from noise and disturbance

No works (including demolition and preparatory work) on the development hereby granted planning permission shall commence until details of a Dust Management Plan and Methods Statement have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These details shall be written in accordance with the Mayor of London's Supplementary Planning Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition'. The demolition and construction of the development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the approved details.Reason: To accord with the recommendations of the submitted Air Quality Assessment and ensure that the development is air quality neutral in accordance with Policy SI 1 of the London Plan.

Prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved (including demolition and all preparatory work), a scheme for the protection of all trees within the neighbouring gardens adjacent to the site's southern boundary and railway land adjacent to the eastern boundary compliant with BS 5837:2012 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme will comprise a detailed Arboricultural Method Statement (AMS) report supplemented by Tree Protection Plan(s) (TPP). The plan(s) shall be of legible scale and clearly show the layout as approved, all relevant existing site features that form a consideration within the protection scheme, and the location/extent of all appropriate protection measures.Specific matters to be addressed within the AMS and TPPs will include:a)	Facilitative pruningb)	location and installation of all utility services/drainage, avoiding the Root Protection Areas (RPA) of all retained trees (RPA as defined within BS 5837:2012)c)	methods of demolition of existing structures within or directly adjacent to RPAsd)	details of all construction that necessitate level changes within RPAse)	a full specification for the installation of boundary treatments within or directly adjacent to RPAsf)	a specification for protective fencing and, if necessary, ground protection, to safeguard all trees during both demolition and construction phases. The Tree Protection Plan(s) shall clearly indicate the alignment of the fencing and extent of ground protectiong)	a specification for scaffolding and ground protection in Construction Exclusion Zones (where necessary)h)	details of site access, temporary parking, on site welfare facilities, loading, unloading and storage of equipment, materials, fuels and waste as well concrete mixing and siting of firesi)	methods to improve the rooting environment for retained and proposed trees and landscapingThe development thereafter shall be implemented in strict accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure that the trees on neighbouring land will not be damaged during demolition or construction and to protect and enhance the appearance and character of the site and its surroundings in accordance with Policy G7 of the London Plan and DMD 80 of the Enfield DMD and pursuant to section 197 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Notwithstanding the details already submitted, prior to the commencement of building works, full details of all hard and soft landscaping of all parts of the site not covered by buildings shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The site shall be landscaped strictly in accordance with the approved details in the first planting season after completion or first occupation of the development, whichever is the sooner. Details shall include:1)	a scaled plan showing all existing vegetation and landscape features to be retained; and trees and plants to be planted2)	a schedule detailing species and sizes, nursery stock type supplier and defect period and numbers/densities of all proposed plants and trees. All plants and tree planting shall be carried out in accordance with those details and at those times.3)	a written five-year maintenance programme for all proposed planting and trees, compliant with current industry best practice and British Standard recommendations including cross-sectional drawings, use of guards or other protective measures and confirmation of location4)	Tree pit design5)	location, type and materials to be used for hard landscaping including specifications, where applicable for:a)	permeable pavingb)	sustainable urban drainage integrationc)	use within tree Root Protection Areas (RPAs)d)	types, materials, design, and dimensions of all new boundary treatments There shall be no excavation or raising or lowering of levels within the prescribed root protection area of any retained trees other than those already agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from completion of the development, die, are removed, or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible, and in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the local planning authority gives written consent to any variation.Reason: To ensure that the aesthetic and ecological value of the site is enhanced post development in line with the Biodiversity Action Plan, Policies CP30 and CP36 of the Core Strategy, Policies DMD37, DMD80 and DMD81 of the Development Management Document and the Publication London Plan.

No works (including demolition and preparatory work) on the development hereby granted planning permission shall commence until details of a demolition and construction logistics plan in line with TfL guidance have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The plan shall detail the arrangements for:a)	the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors.b)	loading and unloading of plant and materials.c)	storage of plant and materials used in construction the development.d)	the erection and maintenance of security hoardings.e)	wheel washing facilities; andf)	a scheme for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works.g)	measures for the control and reduction of noise and vibration.The demolition and construction of the development shall be carried out in accordance with approved details.Reason: To ensure that the transport network and noise and vibration impacts of demolition and construction work associated with the development do not detrimentally impact the operations of surrounding development in accordance with Policies D14 and T7 of the London Plan and DMD 48 and DMD 68.

Notwithstanding the information provided in Drainage Strategy Report Version 5.0 C200805-PIN-XX-XX-RP-C-02 (16th May 2022) the development shall not commence until a detailed Sustainable Drainage Strategy has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The details shall be in line with our DMD Policy SuDS Requirements:a)	Shall be designed to a 1 in 1 and 1 in 100 year storm event with the allowance for climate changeb)	Follow the London Plan Drainage Hierarchy and providing evidence of maximising above ground storagec)	Follow the SuDS management train by providing a number of treatment phases corresponding to the pollution potential of the site and shall utilise source control such as green roofs and/or rain gardens and/or permeable paving with the aim of treating 100% of the runoff generated from hardstanding areasd)	Must restrict the use of traditional drainage features such as gullies and proprietary treatment measures unless used in conjunction with source control SuDS featurese)	The system must be designed to allow for flows that exceed the design capacity to be stored on site or conveyed off-site with minimum impactf)	Clear ownership, management and maintenance arrangements must be establishedg)	The details submitted shall include detailed drawings, levels, sizing, cross sections, and specifications for all SuDS features.Reason: To ensure the sustainable management of water, minimise flood risk, minimise discharge of surface water outside of the curtilage of the property and ensure that the drainage system will remain functional throughout the lifetime of the development in accordance with Policy CP28 of the Core Strategy, DMD Policy 61, and Policies SI12 & SI13 of the London Plan and the NPPF and to maximise opportunities for sustainable development, improve water quality, biodiversity, local amenity and recreation value.
